discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Colored impact and likelihood risk matrix

A colored impact and likelihood risk matrix is a tool used to visually represent and assess risks based on their impact and likelihood. It helps organizations identify and prioritize gaps in their security capabilities by providing a clear visual depiction of where potential risks lie. This matrix can be used to analyze the effectiveness of current security controls and highlight areas needing improvement, enabling organizations to focus their resources on addressing the most critical vulnerabilities.

questions.question_text: When developing a cloud compliance program, what is the PRIMARY reason for a cloud customer to review which cloud services will be deployed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. To determine how those services will fit within its policies and procedures

The primary reason for a cloud customer to review which cloud services will be deployed is to ensure that these services align with the organization's existing policies and procedures. This is crucial for maintaining compliance and ensuring that any new cloud services integrate seamlessly with the organization's established governance, risk management, and compliance frameworks. By doing so, the organization can effectively manage risks and maintain adherence to relevant standards and regulations.

Selected Answer: A
When developing a cloud compliance program, the cloud customer must review the cloud services it deploys and determine how those services fit within its policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain and correct security violations. CCAK P# 125

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a PRIMARY benefit of using a standardized control framework?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. It enables the organization to implement an effective process of control measurement.

The primary benefit of using a standardized control framework is that it allows an organization to systematically implement, measure, and manage controls effectively. By using a framework that provides a consistent set of controls and best practices, organizations can more easily assess their control environment, identify gaps, and ensure that controls are aligned with business objectives and compliance requirements. This structured approach facilitates ongoing monitoring and improvement of control effectiveness, ultimately supporting risk management and organizational governance.

choices.B: It enables the organization to implement an effective process of control measurement.
choices.C: It enables auditors to assess an information system based on a well-defined set of controls.
choices.A: It enables senior management to receive regular and detailed executive reports easily.
choices.D: It enables consultants to speed up the implementation of management systems, thus reducing costs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Cloud Security Alliance (CSA)

The Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) is an industry organization that offers security controls specifically designed for cloud computing environments. It provides resources such as the Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM), which is a cybersecurity control framework for cloud service providers and users to assess the overall security risk of a cloud provider. Additionally, the CSA offers benchmarking tools relevant to cloud security, helping organizations evaluate their cloud security posture against industry standards.

questions.question_text: Which industry organization offers both security controls and cloud-relevant benchmarking?
The CSA STAR Certification is based on criteria outlined the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) in addition to:

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. ISO/IEC 27001 implementation.

The CSA STAR (Security, Trust, Assurance, and Risk) Certification is based on the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) Cloud Controls Matrix (CCM) in addition to the ISO/IEC 27001 implementation. The certification provides a comprehensive framework for cloud security assurance, combining the requirements of ISO/IEC 27001 with the specific cloud-focused controls of the CCM. This allows organizations to demonstrate both general information security management and cloud-specific security practices.
